metadata.title: CVE-2023-5869 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in PostgreSQL that allows authenticated database users toexecute arbitrary code through missing overflow checks during SQL arrayvalue modification. This issue exists due to an integer overflow duringarray modification where a remote user can trigger the overflow byproviding specially crafted data. This enables the execution of arbitrarycode on the target system, allowing users to write arbitrary bytes tomemory and extensively read the server's memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-5869` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
libecpg6 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
libpgtypes3 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
libpq5 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.23-0ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1').
